source.class:
A table of defaults for Swing components. Applications can set/get default values via the UIManager.

Warning: Serialized objects of this class will not be compatible with future Swing releases. The current serialization support is appropriate for short term storage or RMI between applications running the same version of Swing. As of 1.4, support for long term storage of all JavaBeansTM has been added to the java.beans package. Please see {@link java.beans.XMLEncoder}. UIManager Hans Muller Maps from a Locale to a cached Map of the ResourceBundle. This is done so as to avoid an exception being thrown when a value is asked for. Access to this should be done while holding a lock on the UIDefaults, eg synchronized(this). Creates an empty defaults table. Creates an empty defaults table with the specified initial capacity and load factor. initialCapacity the initial capacity of the defaults table loadFactor the load factor of the defaults table java.util.Hashtable 1.6 Creates a defaults table initialized with the specified key/value pairs. For example: 

                  Object[] uiDefaults = {
                  "Font", new Font("Dialog", Font.BOLD, 12),
                  "Color", Color.red,
                  "five", new Integer(5)
                  }
                  UIDefaults myDefaults = new UIDefaults(uiDefaults);
keyValueList an array of objects containing the key/value pairs Returns the value for key. If the value is a UIDefaults.LazyValue then the real value is computed with LazyValue.createValue(), the table entry is replaced, and the real value is returned. If the value is an UIDefaults.ActiveValue the table entry is not replaced - the value is computed with ActiveValue.createValue() for each get() call. If the key is not found in the table then it is searched for in the list of resource bundles maintained by this object. The resource bundles are searched most recently added first using the locale returned by getDefaultLocale. LazyValues and ActiveValues are not supported in the resource bundles. key the desired key the value for key LazyValue ActiveValue java.util.Hashtable#get #getDefaultLocale #addResourceBundle 1.4 Looks up up the given key in our Hashtable and resolves LazyValues or ActiveValues. Quickly handle the common case, without grabbing a lock. If the LazyValue for key is being constructed by another thread then wait and then return the new value, otherwise drop the lock and construct the ActiveValue or the LazyValue. We use the special value PENDING to mark LazyValues that are being constructed. At this point we know that the value of key was a LazyValue or an ActiveValue. If an exception is thrown we'll just put the LazyValue back in the table. Returns the value for key associated with the given locale. If the value is a UIDefaults.LazyValue then the real value is computed with LazyValue.createValue(), the table entry is replaced, and the real value is returned. If the value is an UIDefaults.ActiveValue the table entry is not replaced - the value is computed with ActiveValue.createValue() for each get() call. If the key is not found in the table then it is searched for in the list of resource bundles maintained by this object. The resource bundles are searched most recently added first using the given locale. LazyValues and ActiveValues are not supported in the resource bundles. key the desired key l the desired locale the value for key LazyValue ActiveValue java.util.Hashtable#get #addResourceBundle 1.4 Looks up given key in our resource bundles. A null locale means use the default locale. Returns a Map of the known resources for the given locale. Keep looking Sets the value of key to value for all locales. If key is a string and the new value isn't equal to the old one, fire a PropertyChangeEvent. If value is null, the key is removed from the table. key the unique Object who's value will be used to retrieve the data value associated with it value the new Object to store as data under that key the previous Object value, or null #putDefaults java.util.Hashtable#put Puts all of the key/value pairs in the database and unconditionally generates one PropertyChangeEvent. The events oldValue and newValue will be null and its propertyName will be "UIDefaults". The key/value pairs are added for all locales. keyValueList an array of key/value pairs #put java.util.Hashtable#put If the value of key is a Font return it, otherwise return null. key the desired key if the value for key is a Font, return the Font object; otherwise return null If the value of key for the given Locale is a Font return it, otherwise return null. key the desired key l the desired locale if the value for key and Locale is a Font, return the Font object; otherwise return null 1.4 If the value of key is a Color return it, otherwise return null. key the desired key if the value for key is a Color, return the Color object; otherwise return null If the value of key for the given Locale is a Color return it, otherwise return null. key the desired key l the desired locale if the value for key and Locale is a Color, return the Color object; otherwise return null 1.4 If the value of key is an Icon return it, otherwise return null. key the desired key if the value for key is an Icon, return the Icon object; otherwise return null If the value of key for the given Locale is an Icon return it, otherwise return null. key the desired key l the desired locale if the value for key and Locale is an Icon, return the Icon object; otherwise return null 1.4 If the value of key is a Border return it, otherwise return null. key the desired key if the value for key is a Border, return the Border object; otherwise return null If the value of key for the given Locale is a Border return it, otherwise return null. key the desired key l the desired locale if the value for key and Locale is a Border, return the Border object; otherwise return null 1.4 If the value of key is a String return it, otherwise return null. key the desired key if the value for key is a String, return the String object; otherwise return null If the value of key for the given Locale is a String return it, otherwise return null. key the desired key l the desired Locale if the value for key for the given Locale is a String, return the String object; otherwise return null 1.4 If the value of key is an Integer return its integer value, otherwise return 0. key the desired key if the value for key is an Integer, return its value, otherwise return 0 If the value of key for the given Locale is an Integer return its integer value, otherwise return 0. key the desired key l the desired locale if the value for key and Locale is an Integer, return its value, otherwise return 0 1.4 If the value of key is boolean, return the boolean value, otherwise return false. key an Object specifying the key for the desired boolean value if the value of key is boolean, return the boolean value, otherwise return false. 1.4 If the value of key for the given Locale is boolean, return the boolean value, otherwise return false. key an Object specifying the key for the desired boolean value l the desired locale if the value for key and Locale is boolean, return the boolean value, otherwise return false. 1.4 If the value of key is an Insets return it, otherwise return null. key the desired key if the value for key is an Insets, return the Insets object; otherwise return null If the value of key for the given Locale is an Insets return it, otherwise return null. key the desired key l the desired locale if the value for key and Locale is an Insets, return the Insets object; otherwise return null 1.4 If the value of key is a Dimension return it, otherwise return null. key the desired key if the value for key is a Dimension, return the Dimension object; otherwise return null If the value of key for the given Locale is a Dimension return it, otherwise return null. key the desired key l the desired locale if the value for key and Locale is a Dimension, return the Dimension object; otherwise return null 1.4 The value of get(uidClassID) must be the String name of a class that implements the corresponding ComponentUI class. If the class hasn't been loaded before, this method looks up the class with uiClassLoader.loadClass() if a non null class loader is provided, classForName() otherwise.

If a mapping for uiClassID exists or if the specified class can't be found, return null.

This method is used by getUI, it's usually not necessary to call it directly. uiClassID a string containing the class ID uiClassLoader the object which will load the class the value of Class.forName(get(uidClassID)) #getUI
